Brazil: The Portuguese establish Recife in Pernambuco, in the Northeast of Brazil.
Colombia: Foundation of St. Juan de Pasto by Lorenzo de Aldana Gonzalo Jiménez de Quesada with his troops reach the Muisca Confederation zipa Tisquesusa is beaten in the Spanish conquest of the Muisca at Funza Sagipa becomes the last zipa of Bacatá Francisco César discovers the territory of Antioquia zaque Quemuenchatocha is beaten in Hunza Aquiminzaque becomes the last zaque of Hunza The Sun Temple in Sogamoso (name in Muysccubun: Sugamuxi) was burned by Spanish soldiers
Cuba:
A French fleet briefly occupies Havana.
French corsairs blockade Santiago de Cuba.
Ireland: FitzGerald is hanged, drawn and quartered at Tyburn.
Serbia: Klis Fortress succumbs to the Ottomans enabling Senj to become a Croatian Habsburg Uskok (pirate) stronghold in the Adriatic Sea. Although nominally accepting the sovereignty of the Habsburg Emperor Ferdinand I, Uskoci were a law unto themselves, comprise by refugees from Croatia, Bosnia and Serbia.
